datafield.subfield: National memberships in international nongovernmental organizations, 1966, 1974:
page 13 (Burt R. Baldwin, Central Connecticut State College, New Britain, U.S.A.)
volume 31, numbers 1-2, page 79 (Burt R. Baldwin, Department of Sociology, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain, Connecticut)
The Hartford Courant, via WWW, September 11, 2012

(January 6, 2012 edition; Burt R. Baldwin; born in Jamestown, N.Y. on December 12, 1938; son of Russell Baldwin and Grace Powell; grew up in Gardena, CA; after high school, he served in the peacetime Navy on the USS Princeton; he then attended USC for both his B.A. and his M.A. in sociology; he earned his Ph. D. at Boston College in 1971; his academic teaching career was at Central Connecticut University, from which he retired in 1997; there he founded The Center for Social Research and worked on many research projects himself both locally and internationally; he served as Sociology department chair for many years; he died on January 1, 2012 in Litchfield, CT)
